info.author: Sheng Yang
classifiers: Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
PST:
Pointing Scheduler in responce to Triggers
==============

.. image:: http://img.shields.io/travis/dfm/emcee/master.svg?style=flat
        :target: https://travis-ci.org/saberyoung/fst
.. image:: http://img.shields.io/pypi/dm/emcee.svg?style=flat
        :target: https://pypi.org/project/fst/
.. image:: http://img.shields.io/pypi/v/emcee.svg?style=flat
        :target: https://pypi.org/project/fst/
.. image:: http://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-blue.svg?style=flat
        :target: https://github.com/saberyoung/fst/blob/master/LICENSE

Find more:
https://sngyang.com/fst

Download:

1. pip install pstools --user

2. source activate pst.bash

3. git clone https://github.com/saberyoung/pst.git

   cd pst

   python setup.py install --prefix=/--user

Functions:

1. create pointing list depends on telescope FoV

2. create galaxy list by querying galaxy catalogue(GLADE)

3. read trigger uncertainty map and FoV, recommend:

3.1 galaxy monitoring strategy

3.2 tiling strategy

4. priorization algorithm: trigger prob * mass distribution * distance distributio * etc

5. automatic gcn listener, run step 4 automatically

dust maps: see https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/AFJNWJ

Usage:
see tutorial in sngyang.com/pstools

Don't hesitate to contact me (sheng.yang@inaf.it) if you found any problems in using the tool.
'Anything that can possibly go wrong, will go wrong.'

--MURPHY'S LAW on debugging
info.name: timpy
info.summary: timpy is a python package for source marker in two-dimensional image
info.html_description:
PST: Pointing Scheduler in responce to Triggers ==============

Find more: https://sngyang.com/fst

Download:

  1. pip install pstools –user

  2. source activate pst.bash

  3. git clone https://github.com/saberyoung/pst.git

    cd pst

    python setup.py install –prefix=/–user

Functions:

  1. create pointing list depends on telescope FoV
  2. create galaxy list by querying galaxy catalogue(GLADE)
  3. read trigger uncertainty map and FoV, recommend:

3.1 galaxy monitoring strategy

3.2 tiling strategy

  1. priorization algorithm: trigger prob * mass distribution * distance distributio * etc
  2. automatic gcn listener, run step 4 automatically

dust maps: see https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataset.xhtml?persistentId=doi:10.7910/DVN/AFJNWJ

Usage: see tutorial in sngyang.com/pstools

Don’t hesitate to contact me (sheng.yang@inaf.it) if you found any problems in using the tool. ‘Anything that can possibly go wrong, will go wrong.’

–MURPHY’S LAW on debugging
